 It's an old stereo system I had from 98, it was left down in the barn, get=
ting wet, sitting in water for the last couple years, i let it go and was g=
oing to toss it out thinking it wasn't any good, the dog chewed off the plu=
g on the end, but today, i got it upstairs, and managed to put half of a co=
rd with plug on the other one, and tape it up with the black tape, i took i=
t a part to see the inside, it's really fancy and detailed, and i know noth=
ing about how to find the mute in it, it has lost of stuff it does, and gee=
z, everything is working, CD, 2Tape player with recorder, am fm radio, and =
whatever the button for Video/Aux is, anyone know what that is for?=C2=A0 H=
as a place for head phone, and stuff on back for ante, and a red and a yell=
ow plug for something, I have no idea what.=C2=A0 Anyway, I would like to m=
ake it a ghost box if i can, because the scan on it seems super fast, and i=
t doesn't stop unless the button get pushed.=C2=A0 I got a feeling it may w=
ork well as a ghosty box. sf




-----Original Message-----
From: Ursula Ka=
lin <kalinu@...>

Sent: Mon, Jul=
 26, 2010 3:03 am
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Yippee!!!

          =C2=A0       =
                           yehh for you! What are you using

25/10, SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...> wrote:
 
From: SnowfireL=
@... <SnowfireL@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Yippee!!!
To: RTSC@ya=
hoogroups.com, EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, July 25, 2010, 2:36 PM=


 =C2=A0    Well, it works great!!!=C2=A0 Now,=C2=A0how the heck to cut th=
e mute, and make it scan?=C2=A0 Bet it would be a good ghost box, even the =
big speakers still work!!!=C2=A0 so, cool. sf
 =C2=A0




      
          =
       
   
       
  


----------MB_8CCFAA8FC7243D6_1EC4_67AED_webmail-m076.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/html; charset="utf-8"


<div style=3D"font-family: arial; color: black; font-size: 10pt;"> It's an=
 old stereo system I had from 98, it was left down in the barn, getting wet=
, sitting in water for the last couple years, i let it go and was going to =
toss it out thinking it wasn't any good, the dog chewed off the plug on the=
 end, but today, i got it upstairs, and managed to put half of a cord with =
plug on the other one, and tape it up with the black tape, i took it a part=
 to see the inside, it's really fancy and detailed, and i know nothing abou=
t how to find the mute in it, it has lost of stuff it does, and geez, every=
thing is working, CD, 2Tape player with recorder, am fm radio, and whatever=
 the button for Video/Aux is, anyone know what that is for?  Has a pla=
ce for head phone, and stuff on back for ante, and a red and a yellow plug =
for something, I have no idea what.  Anyway, I would like to make it a=
 ghost box if i can, because the scan on it seems super fast, and it doesn'=
t stop unless the button get pushed.  I got a feeling it may work well=
 as a ghosty box. sf<br>
<br>
</div>

<div><br>
</div>
